Title: My Neighbor Totoro
Description: Two girls move to the country to be near their ailing mother and discover the surrounding trees are inhabited by Totoros, magical spirits of the forest. When the youngest runs away from home, the older sister seeks help from the spirits to find her.

Genre.Name: Fantasy
Genre.Description: Involves magic, mythical creatures, or the supernatural.

Director.Name: Hayao Miyazaki
Director.Bio: Co-founder of Studio Ghibli, known for his imaginative tales and mastery of animation.

Title: Spirited Away
Description: During her family's move to the suburbs, a sullen 10-year-old girl wanders into a world ruled by gods, witches, and spirits, and where humans are changed into beasts.

Genre.Name: Fantasy
Genre.Description: Involves magic, mythical creatures, or the supernatural.

Director.Name: Hayao Miyazaki
Director.Bio: Co-founder of Studio Ghibli, known for his imaginative tales and mastery of animation.

Title: Princess Mononoke
Description: On a journey to find the cure for a Tatarigami's curse, Ashitaka finds himself in the middle of a war between the forest gods and Tatara, a mining colony. In this quest, he also meets San, the Mononoke Hime.

Director.Name: Hayao Miyazaki
Director.Bio: Co-founder of Studio Ghibli, known for his imaginative tales and mastery of animation.

Title: Howl's Moving Castle
Description: When an unconfident young woman is cursed with an old body by a spiteful witch, her only chance of breaking the spell lies with a self-indulgent yet insecure young wizard and his companions in his legged, walking castle.

Genre.Name: Fantasy
Genre.Description: Involves magic, mythical creatures, or the supernatural.

Director.Name: Hayao Miyazaki
Director.Bio: Co-founder of Studio Ghibli, known for his imaginative tales and mastery of animation.

Title: Kiki's Delivery Service
Description: A young witch, on her mandatory year of independent life, finds fitting into a new community difficult while she supports herself by running an air courier service.

Director.Name: Hayao Miyazaki
Director.Bio: Co-founder of Studio Ghibli, known for his imaginative tales and mastery of animation.

Title: Ponyo
Description: An adventurous little girl and an overeager goldfish princess who dreams of becoming human embark on a quest together.

Genre.Name: Fantasy
Genre.Description: Involves magic, mythical creatures, or the supernatural.

Director.Name: Hayao Miyazaki
Director.Bio: Co-founder of Studio Ghibli, known for his imaginative tales and mastery of animation.

Title: The Wind Rises
Description: A look at the life of Jiro Horikoshi, the man who designed Japanese fighter planes during World War II.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: Focuses on character development and plot.

Director.Name: Hayao Miyazaki
Director.Bio: Co-founder of Studio Ghibli, known for his imaginative tales and mastery of animation.

Title: Arrietty
Description: The Clock family are four-inch-tall people who live anonymously in another family's residence, borrowing simple items to make their home. Life changes for the Clocks when their daughter, Arrietty, is discovered.

Genre.Name: Fantasy
Genre.Description: Involves magic, mythical creatures, or the supernatural.

Director.Name: Hiromasa Yonebayashi
Director.Bio: A Japanese animator and director, known for his work with Studio Ghibli on films such as Spirited Away and Ponyo before directing Arrietty.

Title: Tales from Earthsea
Description: In a mythical land, a man and a young boy investigate a series of unusual occurrences.

Genre.Name: Fantasy
Genre.Description: Involves magic, mythical creatures, or the supernatural.

Director.Name: Gorō Miyazaki
Director.Bio: Son of Hayao Miyazaki, Gorō has directed films like Tales from Earthsea and From Up on Poppy Hill.

Title: Grave of the Fireflies
Description: A devastating meditation on the human cost of war, this animated tale follows a brother and sister who struggle to survive in Japan during World War II.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: Focuses on character development and plot.

Director.Name: Isao Takahata
Director.Bio: A co-founder of Studio Ghibli, known for his poignant storytelling and commitment to realistic animation.
